content.description: From a stand, climb the right arete to the top.  Tricky and harder than it looks.Climbed in June of 2020.  I'm guessing others have done this before me.
content.location: Right arete of the Ace of Spades boulder.

content.description: Start on good holds and shoot straight up the face, avoiding the left arete and the ledge system and corner out right.  Gain a slopey crimp, get a good high foot, and pull down until the lip is within reach.  This is listed as a 5.11b in Swartling's guidebook (3rd edition) but its height seems more fitting of a bouldering grade and listing.
content.location: This is a ways above the Hogleg/Anchorpoint group. The problem is immediately right of the unnamed 5.5 chimney on Picnic Wall, and climbs the narrow face between that chimney and a ledge that is at 10-12 feet. Or.. Same height on the hillside as Ace of Spades, 100 feet north across the talus gully on a scenic perch.  Track Cracks is a sought after route on this wall.

climbs.name: Exit Through the Gift Shop
climbs.fa: Ben Summay, Anna Boatman, Ian CB, Eric Cashman

content.description:
Start as for Aramandi and after the first move traverse left for two moves. Pull up into the slab and head to the top without letting the loose branches and vines pull you down. Hard first couple of moves with a fun slab finish.

 Variation: Start two moves in on the two left facing sidepulls. Make the shouldery move left and pull up into the slab. Goes at around V2.
content.protection: A couple pads and maybe a spotter
content.location: On the Ace of Spades boulder left of the main face.

climbs.name: Aramandi
climbs.fa: Eric Cashman, Ian CB, Ben Summay

content.description: Start sitting, with a crimp/pinch for the right hand and a crimpy sidepull for the left.  Climb the arete.  Quite tiring and a little trickier than it looks.
content.location: Left arete if looking at the boulder.

climbs.name: Ace of Spades
climbs.fa: Eric Cashman, Ben Summay, Ian CB

content.description: Start sitting in the middle of the pretty face.  Left hand on a sidepull, right on an edge below.  Gain the right arete and climb the sweet feature.  This thing is pretty darn awesome! The stand start is a fun V3/4ish problem.
content.protection: Pads.  Good landing though you want probably three.

content.description: Home to a very nice boulder and likely other problems as well.
